intro: Heteropterys fragilis, commonly known as the fragile heteropterys, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
